Pre-Game Insights: India will be hopeful of getting their top-order firing after consecutive collapses.
Sri Lanka have had two entirely different games as their top-order returned to form in the second contest while their middle-order failed to fire in the second contest.
Dasun Shanakaâ€™s shrewd captaincy has been a driving force for the Lankans as he has led both with the brain and the brawn to make this a series to remember for both the sides.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A total of 4 T20Is have so far been played here with 2 of them being secured batting first while the other 2 have been won chasing.
The average first innings score is 179 while the average score while chasing slumps to 149.
Going by the antiquity of the surface, it has some turn that could assist the bowlers.
Others: India and Sri Lanka are set to face off in the series finale at the Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Rajkot on 7th January 2023.
